alert.note: Alert for Windham (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 16 at 4:45PM EDT until July 16 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR EAST CENTRAL WINDHAM, SOUTHWESTERN BRISTOL, BRISTOL, KENT, NEWPORT, PROVIDENCE AND WASHINGTON COUNTIES... At 445 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 2 to 3 inches in 1 hour. Heavy rains over southern Rhode Island into Long Island New York will move over the warned area. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible. Flash flooding has already occurred and additional flooding is expected to develop in the warned area. With excessive rainfall expected, significant flash flooding is possible, as torrential rains move over the warned area over the next few hours. This will especially be possible in the Providence, Warwick and Cranston areas. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. Areas of flooding are ongoing from earlier rounds of heavy rain in East Providence and Cranston, per law enforcement reports. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Inundation in basements and businesses is possible. Rapid rises of creeks and streams to over bankfull. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Providence, Fall River, Warwick, Cranston, Pawtucket, East Providence, Woonsocket, Coventry, Cumberland, North Providence, South Kingstown, West Warwick, Johnston, North Attleborough, North Kingstown, Newport, Bristol, Attleboro, Westerly and Smithfield. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
